title: თავის წარდგენა

title: ამინდის შესახებ

title: ყოველდღიური რუტინა
text: I usually wake up at seven o'clock and take a quick shower. For breakfast, I have coffee and toast. I leave home at half past eight and take the metro to work. My office is in the center of the city. I work from nine to six. After work, I go to the gym three times a week. On other days, I cook dinner and watch a movie.

How often does the speaker go to the gym?

title: მაღაზიაში
text: I need to buy a new jacket for winter. This blue one looks nice. How much does it cost? One hundred and fifty lari. That's a bit expensive. Do you have anything cheaper? Yes, we have this black jacket on sale for ninety lari. It's very warm and comfortable. I'll take it!

title: ტელეფონით საუბარი

title: მოგზაურობის შესახებ
text: Next month, my husband and I are going to Turkey for a week. We booked a hotel in Antalya near the beach. The flight takes about two hours from Tbilisi. We plan to swim, visit historical places, and try the local food. We're both very excited because this is our first trip abroad together.

title: ახალ სამსახურში

title: ექიმთან ვიზიტი
text: Doctor, I've had a bad headache for three days. I also feel tired all the time and I can't sleep well at night. Have you been drinking enough water? Probably not. I've been very busy at work and I often forget to eat lunch. Well, you need to rest more, drink at least two liters of water a day, and eat regular meals. I'll also give you some medicine for the headache.

title: საცხოვრებლის ძებნა
text: I'm looking for a one-bedroom apartment near the metro station. My budget is about five hundred lari per month. I need it to be furnished, with a washing machine and internet. I saw an advertisement online for a place on Chavchavadze Avenue. It looks perfect, but I need to see it first. Can we visit it tomorrow afternoon?

title: ახალი ამბების მოხსენება
text: In local news today, the city council has approved plans to build a new public library in the central district. The modern three-story building will include a children's section, a digital media lab, and a café. Construction is expected to begin in March and should be completed within eighteen months. The project will cost approximately four million lari. The mayor stated that the library will serve over fifty thousand residents in the area.

questions.q: What is being built?
When will construction begin?
How many residents will the library serve?

title: ინსტრუქციები
text: Today I'm going to teach you how to make traditional Georgian churchkhela. First, you need to prepare grape juice by boiling it with flour until it becomes thick. While you're waiting, thread walnuts onto a string using a large needle. Once the grape mixture has thickened, dip the walnut strings into it several times until they are well coated. Then hang them to dry for five to seven days in a cool place. The result is a delicious and healthy snack that can last for months.

questions.q: What is being made?
What is threaded onto a string?
How long does it take to dry?

title: მოკლე ამბავი
text: Last summer, while hiking in the mountains of Svaneti, I got lost in thick fog. I couldn't see the trail and my phone had no signal. I felt scared but tried to stay calm. After walking carefully for about an hour, I heard a dog barking in the distance. I followed the sound and found a small village. An elderly couple invited me into their home, gave me warm food, and let me stay the night. The next morning, their grandson guided me back to the main trail. That experience taught me to always carry a map and never hike alone.

questions.q: Where did the speaker get lost?
How did the speaker find the village?
What lesson did the speaker learn?
opts: Always carry a map and don't hike alone

title: აღწერა
text: Barcelona is one of the most visited cities in Europe. Located on the northeast coast of Spain, it combines beautiful beaches with stunning architecture. The most famous building is the Sagrada Familia, a church designed by architect Antoni Gaudí that has been under construction since 1882. The city is also known for its lively food markets, especially La Boqueria, where you can find fresh seafood, fruit, and traditional Spanish dishes. If you enjoy football, you can visit Camp Nou, one of the largest stadiums in the world.

questions.q: Where is Barcelona located?
Since when has the Sagrada Familia been under construction?
What is La Boqueria?

title: კლიმატის ცვლილება
text: Scientists warn that global temperatures have risen by about one degree Celsius since the late nineteenth century. This may sound small, but even tiny changes in average temperature can cause major problems. Ice sheets in Antarctica and Greenland are melting faster than expected, causing sea levels to rise. Many coastal cities could face serious flooding in the coming decades. Experts say we need to reduce carbon emissions by at least forty percent before twenty-thirty to avoid the worst effects of climate change.

questions.q: How much have global temperatures risen?
What is happening to ice sheets?
By how much must carbon emissions be reduced?

title: ტექნოლოგია და განათლება
text: Online learning has transformed education worldwide. During the pandemic, millions of students attended classes through video platforms like Zoom and Google Meet. While some students enjoyed the flexibility of learning from home, others struggled without direct interaction with teachers. Research shows that a combination of online and in-person learning, often called blended learning, produces the best results. Schools in Georgia are gradually adopting digital tools, though internet access in rural areas remains a significant challenge.

questions.q: What platforms were used during the pandemic?
What is 'blended learning'?
opts: A mix of online and in-person learning

questions.q: What challenge do rural areas in Georgia face?

title: სპორტის ისტორია
text: Football is the most popular sport in the world, with over four billion fans. The modern game was developed in England in the nineteenth century, though people have played similar ball games for thousands of years. The first official international match was played between England and Scotland in eighteen seventy-two. Today, the FIFA World Cup is watched by billions and takes place every four years. Georgia's national team has been improving steadily, and Georgian players are now competing in some of Europe's top leagues.

questions.q: How many fans does football have worldwide?
When was the first international match played?
How often is the FIFA World Cup held?

title: ჯანსაღი კვება
text: A balanced diet is essential for maintaining good health. Nutritionists recommend eating plenty of vegetables, fruits, and whole grains, while limiting processed foods, sugar, and salt. The Mediterranean diet, which includes olive oil, fish, and fresh vegetables, has been linked to lower rates of heart disease and longer life expectancy. In Georgia, traditional cuisine actually shares many elements with this healthy approach, with its emphasis on fresh herbs, walnuts, beans, and seasonal vegetables. The key is moderation and variety in what you eat.

questions.q: What do nutritionists recommend limiting?
What has the Mediterranean diet been linked to?
opts: Lower heart disease and longer life

questions.q: What does Georgian cuisine emphasize?
opts: Fresh herbs, walnuts, beans, and seasonal vegetables

title: დისტანციური მუშაობა
text: The shift toward remote work has fundamentally altered the professional landscape. While corporations initially adopted work-from-home policies as an emergency measure during the pandemic, many have since discovered that productivity often remains stable or even improves. However, the long-term psychological effects deserve attention. Research from Stanford University indicates that fully remote workers report higher levels of isolation and difficulty in establishing boundaries between professional and personal life. A hybrid model, combining two or three office days with remote work, appears to strike the optimal balance, offering flexibility while preserving the collaborative culture that drives innovation.

questions.q: What did Stanford research reveal about fully remote workers?
opts: They feel isolated and have difficulty with boundaries

questions.q: What model appears to be optimal?
What does the hybrid model preserve?

title: ხელოვნური ინტელექტი
text: The debate surrounding artificial intelligence has intensified as these systems become increasingly sophisticated. Proponents argue that AI has the potential to revolutionize healthcare through early disease detection, optimize energy consumption to combat climate change, and democratize education by providing personalized learning experiences. Critics, however, raise legitimate concerns about algorithmic bias, mass surveillance, and the displacement of workers in industries ranging from manufacturing to creative fields. Perhaps the most nuanced position acknowledges that AI is neither inherently beneficial nor harmful — its impact depends entirely on the ethical frameworks and regulations we choose to implement.

questions.q: What do AI proponents claim about healthcare?
opts: AI can enable early disease detection
AI is not useful in healthcare

questions.q: What concerns do critics raise?
opts: AI costs too much to develop

questions.q: What does the 'nuanced position' suggest?
opts: AI's impact depends on ethical frameworks and regulations

title: საქართველოს ღვინის ისტორია
text: Archaeological evidence suggests that Georgia is the birthplace of wine, with the earliest traces of winemaking dating back approximately eight thousand years. The traditional Georgian method involves fermenting grape juice in large clay vessels called qvevri, which are buried underground. This technique was recognized by UNESCO as an Intangible Cultural Heritage in twenty thirteen. Despite centuries of foreign occupation that threatened Georgian cultural practices, winemaking remained central to national identity. Today, the country produces over five hundred indigenous grape varieties, making it one of the most diverse wine regions on earth, and Georgian natural wines have gained a devoted following among international sommeliers.

questions.q: How old is Georgian winemaking according to archaeological evidence?
What are qvevri?
How many indigenous grape varieties does Georgia produce?

title: ურბანიზაცია
text: The United Nations projects that by twenty-fifty, nearly seventy percent of the world's population will live in urban areas, up from roughly fifty-five percent today. This rapid urbanization presents both opportunities and challenges. Cities are engines of economic growth, offering better access to employment, education, and healthcare. However, unplanned urban expansion often leads to overcrowded housing, inadequate infrastructure, and environmental degradation. Air pollution in major cities is responsible for an estimated seven million premature deaths annually. Sustainable urban planning, including investment in public transportation, green spaces, and energy-efficient buildings, is essential to ensuring that cities remain livable for future generations.

questions.q: What percentage of the world's population will live in cities by 2050?
How many premature deaths does urban air pollution cause annually?
What is described as essential for future cities?

title: ფსიქოლოგია
text: Behavioral economists have demonstrated that human decision-making is far less rational than classical economic theory assumes. Daniel Kahneman's groundbreaking research identified two distinct cognitive systems: System One, which operates automatically and quickly with little effort, and System Two, which allocates attention to complex mental activities. Most of our daily decisions are made by System One, relying on mental shortcuts called heuristics. While these shortcuts are efficient, they can lead to systematic errors known as cognitive biases. For instance, the availability heuristic causes people to overestimate the probability of events they can easily recall, such as plane crashes, while underestimating more common risks like car accidents.

questions.q: What did Kahneman's research identify?
What are heuristics?
What does the availability heuristic cause?

title: მედიაწიგნიერება
titleEn: Media Literacy in the Digital Age
text: In an era of information overload, the ability to critically evaluate media content has become as fundamental as traditional literacy. Social media algorithms create echo chambers by showing users content that reinforces their existing beliefs, making it increasingly difficult to encounter diverse perspectives. The proliferation of deepfake technology — artificial intelligence that can generate convincing but entirely fabricated video and audio — poses an unprecedented threat to public trust. Educational institutions worldwide are beginning to integrate media literacy programs into their curricula, teaching students to identify misinformation, verify sources, and understand the economic incentives that drive content creation on digital platforms.

questions.q: What do social media algorithms create?
What is deepfake technology?
opts: AI that generates fake but convincing video and audio

questions.q: What are educational institutions beginning to teach?
